main_definition: The ability of two or more people, things, systems, etc., to exist or work together without conflict.

meanings_and_examples.definition: In relationships, the extent to which partners are well-suited for each other in terms of interests, values, and personalities
meanings_and_examples.example: The couple had great compatibility when it came to their shared love for hiking and exploring nature.

meanings_and_examples.definition: In technology or software, the ability of different systems or devices to work together effectively
meanings_and_examples.example: My new phone is compatible with my old computer, so I can transfer files between them easily.

meanings_and_examples.definition: In genetics, the likelihood that two organisms will breed and produce offspring
meanings_and_examples.example: The pea plants were found to be highly compatible in terms of their traits, leading to a successful hybrid generation.

meanings_and_examples.definition: In chemistry, the degree to which substances can mix or react with each other without forming unwanted byproducts
meanings_and_examples.example: The two chemicals were found to be highly compatible and could be mixed together safely for a reaction.
